lead_paragraph: In a lawsuit against two agencies, the plaintiffs say a promise was broken when nine schools labeled “persistently failing” showed improvement but were removed from a program that offers grants.

headline.print_headline: Parents at ‘Failing’ Schools Sue After State Money for Improvement Is Denied
headline.main: Parents Sue After New York State Denies Money to ‘Failing’ Schools

snippet: In a lawsuit against two agencies, the plaintiffs say a promise was broken when nine schools labeled “persistently failing” showed improvement but were removed from a program that offers grants....
abstract: Group of public school parents sues New York State's Education Dept and Budget Division for money allocated under receivership program to help improve 'persistently failing' schools; at issue is fact that schools in question have been removed from failing list after gains made in first year of program, but money is promised for two consecutive years.
